document.title: Schwartz functions, Hermite functions, and the Hermite operator

para.p:
For
∈ ϕ
⁢
C ∞
( R , C )
and
≥ p 0
, let

Math.text: (absolute-value@(phi)) _ p = (supremum _ (0 less= k less= p))@((supremum _ (u element-of R))@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ (p / 2) * absolute-value@(phi ^ k * u)))

para.p:
We define
S
to be the set of those
∈ ϕ
⁢
C ∞
( R , C )
such that
<
| ϕ |
p
∞
for all
≥ p 0
.
S
is a complex vector space and each
| ⋅
| p
is a norm, and because each
| ⋅
| p
is a norm, a fortiori
{ | ⋅
| p
: p ≥ 0 }
is a separating family of seminorms. With the topology induced by this family of seminorms,
S
is a Fréchet space. 1 footnote 1 1 footnote 1 Walter Rudin, Functional Analysis, second ed., p. 184, Theorem 7.4. Furthermore,
: D
→ S S
defined by

Math.text: formulae@(D * phi * x = phi ^ prime * x, x element-of R)

para.p:
and
: M
→ S S
defined by

Math.text: formulae@(M * phi * x = x * phi * x, x element-of R)

para.p: are continuous linear maps.

Let
S ′
be the collection of continuous linear maps
→ S C
. For
∈ ϕ S
, define
:
e ϕ
→
S ′
C
by

Math.text: formulae@(e _ phi * omega = omega * phi, omega element-of S ^ prime)

para.p:
The initial topology for the collection
{
e ϕ
:
∈ ϕ S
}
is called the weak-* topology on
S ′
. With this topology,
S ′
is a locally convex space whose dual space is
{
e ϕ
:
∈ ϕ S
}
.

For
≥ p 0
and
∈
ϕ , ψ
S
, let

Math.text: (closed-interval@(phi, psi)) _ p = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@((integral _ R)@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ p * phi ^ k * u * overline@(psi ^ k * u) * differential-d@(u)))

para.p: and let

Math.text: ((delimited-[]@(phi)) _ p) ^ 2 = (closed-interval@(phi, phi)) _ p = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@((integral _ R)@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * u)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(u)))

We relate the norms

p

For each
≥ p 1

∈ ϕ S
,

Math.text: (1 / (p * square-root@(pi))) * (absolute-value@(phi)) _ (p - 1) less= (delimited-[]@(phi)) _ p less= square-root@((p + 1) * pi) * (absolute-value@(phi)) _ (p + 1)

para.p:
For
0 ≤ k ≤ p
,

Math.text: (integral _ R)@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * u)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(u)) less= (supremum _ (u element-of R))@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ (p + 1) * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * u)) ^ 2 * (integral _ R)@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ (- 1) * differential-d@(u)))
(integral _ R)@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * u)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(u))
absent less= (supremum _ (u element-of R))@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ (p + 1) * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * u)) ^ 2 * (integral _ R)@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ (- 1) * differential-d@(u)))
absent = (supremum _ (u element-of R))@(((1 + u ^ 2) ^ (p + 1) * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * u)) ^ 2) cdot pi)
absent = (supremum _ (u element-of R))@(((1 + u ^ 2) ^ (p + 1) * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * u)) ^ 2) cdot pi)
absent less= pi * ((absolute-value@(phi)) _ (p + 1)) ^ 2
absent less= pi * ((absolute-value@(phi)) _ (p + 1)) ^ 2

para.p: hence

Math.text: ((delimited-[]@(phi)) _ p) ^ 2 = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@((integral _ R)@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * u)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(u)))
((delimited-[]@(phi)) _ p) ^ 2
absent = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@((integral _ R)@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * u)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(u)))
absent less= ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(pi * ((absolute-value@(phi)) _ (p + 1)) ^ 2)
absent less= ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(pi * ((absolute-value@(phi)) _ (p + 1)) ^ 2)
absent = (p + 1) * pi * ((absolute-value@(phi)) _ (p + 1)) ^ 2
absent = (p + 1) * pi * ((absolute-value@(phi)) _ (p + 1)) ^ 2

para.p:
For
0 ≤ k ≤
- p 1
and
∈ u R
, using the fundamental theorem of calculus and the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality,

Math.text: absolute-value@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ ((p - 1) / 2) * phi ^ k * u) = absolute-value@(((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ u)@(((1 + t ^ 2) ^ ((p - 1) / 2) * phi ^ k * t) ^ prime * differential-d@(t)))
absolute-value@((1 + u ^ 2) ^ ((p - 1) / 2) * phi ^ k * u)
absent = absolute-value@(((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ u)@(((1 + t ^ 2) ^ ((p - 1) / 2) * phi ^ k * t) ^ prime * differential-d@(t)))
absent less= (integral _ R)@(absolute-value@((p - 1) * t * (1 + t ^ 2) ^ ((p - 1) / 2 - 1) * phi ^ k * t) * differential-d@(t))
absent less= (integral _ R)@(absolute-value@((p - 1) * t * (1 + t ^ 2) ^ ((p - 1) / 2 - 1) * phi ^ k * t) * differential-d@(t))
+ (integral _ R)@(absolute-value@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ ((p - 1) / 2) * phi ^ (k + 1) * t) * differential-d@(t))
+ (integral _ R)@(absolute-value@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ ((p - 1) / 2) * phi ^ (k + 1) * t) * differential-d@(t))
absent less= (p - 1) * (integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ (- 1 / 2) * (1 + t ^ 2) ^ ((p - 1) / 2) * absolute-value@(phi ^ k * t) * differential-d@(t))
absent less= (p - 1) * (integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ (- 1 / 2) * (1 + t ^ 2) ^ ((p - 1) / 2) * absolute-value@(phi ^ k * t) * differential-d@(t))
+ (integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ (- 1 / 2) * (1 + t ^ 2) ^ (p / 2) * absolute-value@(phi ^ (k + 1) * t) * differential-d@(t))
+ (integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ (- 1 / 2) * (1 + t ^ 2) ^ (p / 2) * absolute-value@(phi ^ (k + 1) * t) * differential-d@(t))

absent less= (p - 1) * ((integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ (- 1) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2) * ((integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ (p - 1) * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * t)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2)

absent less= (p - 1) * ((integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ (- 1) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2) * ((integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ (p - 1) * (absolute-value@(phi ^ k * t)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2)
+ ((integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ (- 1) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2) * ((integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(phi ^ (k + 1) * t)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2)
+ ((integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ (- 1) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2) * ((integral _ R)@((1 + t ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(phi ^ (k + 1) * t)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2)
absent less= (p - 1) * square-root@(pi) * (delimited-[]@(phi)) _ (p - 1) + square-root@(pi) * (delimited-[]@(phi)) _ p
absent less= (p - 1) * square-root@(pi) * (delimited-[]@(phi)) _ (p - 1) + square-root@(pi) * (delimited-[]@(phi)) _ p
absent less= p * square-root@(pi) * (delimited-[]@(phi)) _ p
absent less= p * square-root@(pi) * (delimited-[]@(phi)) _ p

para.p: which shows that

Math.text: (absolute-value@(phi)) _ (p - 1) less= p * square-root@(pi) * (delimited-[]@(phi)) _ p

S

Math.text: (open-interval@(D * phi, psi)) _ (L ^ 2) = (integral _ R)@(phi ^ prime * x * overline@(psi * x) * differential-d@(x)) = - (integral _ R)@(phi * x * overline@(psi ^ prime * x) * differential-d@(x)) = (open-interval@(phi, (- D) * psi)) _ (L ^ 2)

para.p: and

Math.text: (open-interval@(M * phi, psi)) _ (L ^ 2) = (integral _ R)@(x * phi * x * overline@(psi * x) * differential-d@(x)) = (open-interval@(phi, M * psi)) _ (L ^ 2)

para.p: Thus,

Math.text: (open-interval@(B * phi, psi)) _ (L ^ 2) = (open-interval@(D * phi, psi)) _ (L ^ 2) + (open-interval@(M * phi, psi)) _ (L ^ 2)
(open-interval@(B * phi, psi)) _ (L ^ 2)
absent = (open-interval@(D * phi, psi)) _ (L ^ 2) + (open-interval@(M * phi, psi)) _ (L ^ 2)
absent = (open-interval@(phi, (- D) * psi)) _ (L ^ 2) + (open-interval@(phi, M * psi)) _ (L ^ 2)
absent = (open-interval@(phi, (- D) * psi)) _ (L ^ 2) + (open-interval@(phi, M * psi)) _ (L ^ 2)
absent = (open-interval@(phi, C * psi)) _ (L ^ 2)
absent = (open-interval@(phi, C * psi)) _ (L ^ 2)

para.p: and

Math.text: (open-interval@(C * phi, psi)) _ (L ^ 2) = (open-interval@(phi, B * psi)) _ (L ^ 2)

para.p: We shall use these calculations to obtain the following lemma.

≥ p 0

para.p:
We define the Fourier transform
: F
→ S S
by

Math.text: formulae@(F * phi * xi = (integral _ R)@(phi * x * e ^ (- i * xi * x) * ((d * x) / (2 * pi) ^ (1 / 2))), xi element-of R)

para.p:
: F
→ S S
is a continuous linear map, and satisfies

Math.text: formulae@(F * M = i * D * F, F * D = i * M * F)

para.p: From these we obtain

Math.text: formulae@(F * A = A * F, formulae@(F * B = i * B * F, F * C = - i * C * F))

para.p: and one proves the following using the above.

For
≥ n 0
,

Math.text: F * h _ n = (- i) ^ n * h _ n
